abstracts.cdata!:
The proposed loan for Brazil supports a
            second set of microeconomic and institutional reforms (the
            Growth Program) that foster sustainable and equitable growth
            by favoring capital accumulation and productivity gains in
            Brazil. It seeks to deepen the Program initiated by the
            First Loan by consolidating key progress in the originally
            four selected areas: (i) reducing logistics costs, (ii)
            enhancing business environment, (iii) improving financial
            sector efficiency, access, and soundness, and (iv)
            increasing technological progress and innovation - and
            defining new conditions for further continuation.
